meanings.definition: A car that carries passengers for a fare.
meanings.sent1: I took a taxi to the airport.
meanings.sent2: The taxi driver knew all the shortcuts in the city.
meanings.sent3: The taxi driver joked that his car was a magic carpet.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, taxis are like bees buzzing around.
meanings.sent5: The yellow taxi stood out among the sea of cars.

meanings.sent1: We will taxi to the hotel after landing.
meanings.sent2: She decided to taxi instead of taking the bus.
meanings.sent3: The family planned to taxi around the city for sightseeing.
meanings.sent4: The plane began to taxi down the runway for takeoff.
meanings.sent5: They always taxi to the train station for convenience.

meanings.sent1: The company will taxi the employees to the conference.
meanings.sent2: He offered to taxi his friends to the party.
meanings.sent3: The idea to taxi the pets to the vet seemed amusing.
meanings.sent4: The storm would taxi the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The crane carefully taxied the heavy load to its destination.
